title: Larvik Turn
text:
Larvik Turn & Idrettsforening is a <a href="Norway">Norwegian</a> sports club that does <a href="Football%20%28soccer%29">football</a>, <a href="Team%20Handball">handball</a>, <a href="sport%20of%20athletics">athletics</a>, <a href="wrestling">wrestling</a>, and <a href="gymnastics">gymnastics</a>.
The club was founded as early as 1865, and has been playing football since 1906. The football team was at its best during the 1950s, when it won the <a href="Norwegian%20Premier%20League">Norwegian Premier League</a> three times; in 1953, 1955, and 1956. The club's only <a href="Norwegian%20football%20cup">cup</a> final appearance came in 1956, but this match was lost 2–1 to <a href="Skeid%20Fotball">Skeid</a>. Former <a href="Norway%20national%20football%20team">Norwegian internationals</a> <a href="Gunnar%20Thoresen%20%28footballer%29">Gunnar Thoresen</a>, <a href="Hallvar%20Thoresen">Hallvar Thoresen</a>, <a href="Tom%20Sundby">Tom Sundby</a> and <a href="Gunnar%20Halle">Gunnar Halle</a> have all played for Larvik Turn & I.F.
The most prominent representative of the athletics section is Lars Martin Kaupang, who had the Norwegian record in 1500 metres with 3:37.4 minutes from 30 June 1976 until 29 April 2012.
League participations.
First Level: 1937–1948 (League wasn't played between 1939 and 1947 due to German invasion), 1952–1962
Second Level: 1948–1952, 1963, 1973–1977 (5 seasons)
Third Level: 1964–1967 (4 seasons), 1970–1972 (3 seasons), 1978–1982 (5 seasons), 1988, 1997–1998 (2 seasons)
Fourth Level: 1968–1969 (2 seasons), 1983–1987 (5 seasons), 1989–1996 (8 seasons), 1999–
